result.execSummary:
The defendant Jennifer Lynn Boyle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 1/2 years bifurcated sentence.  Eligible for CIP and SAP.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence if revoked.
Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Mental health assessment and any follow through with any recommendations from provider or agent.  Firearm warning given. Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jennifer Lynn Boyle

records.addlTxt: Does not plan to seek postconviction relief.

8:40 AM Defendant Jennifer Lynn Boyle in court, in custody.  Attorney Ashley Castro in court for Jennifer Lynn Boyle.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  Upon plea to Ct. 1 the State would recommend 18 mo. IC and 24 mo. ES, i/s, 2 yr. probation, consecutive to any other sentence if revoked.  Court performs plea colloquy.  Defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters her plea.  Parties make sentencing arguments.  Defendant speaks on her own behalf.  
Plea:
Ct. 1- 3 1/12 yr. WPS, 18 mo. IC and 24 mo. ES, i/s, 2 yr. probation, consecutive to any other sentence if revoked.   Eligible for CIP and SAP.
BTC: 
Ct. 1- GUILTY
Ct. 2- DRI

Conditions:
No alcohol or controlled substances to be monitored by random UA's/breathalyzers.  AODA assessment and any follow through with any recommendations from agent. 
Mental health assessment and any follow through with any recommendations from provider or agent. 
Obtain and maintain full time employment.  
Court Costs.
DNA Sample and Surcharge.
FAW/Vote.

records.addlTxt: Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim J.D (person, property, residence or family).

Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
